summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing whether to include photos in an indictment, referencing the use of photos in a prior 'horse case' and the 'iconic' photo of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. The discussion centers on legal strategy for a press conference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM' in the email chain; the subject of the indictment being discussed, with mention of an 'iconic' photo of her with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE' in the email chain; mentioned in relation to the 'iconic' photo with Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Described together in an 'iconic' photo, with the indictment concerning their alleged joint criminal activity.

events.title: Prosecutor Discussion on Indictment Strategy
events.description: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY email about whether to include photos of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, and locations of abuse, in an indictment to use them at a press conference.

events.title: Prior 'Horse Case' Indictment
events.description: Referenced as a prior case where evidence photos of horses were included in an indictment to be used in a press conference.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively planning the indictment and press conference strategy for Ghislaine Maxwell in June 2020.
The discussion references an 'iconic' publicly available photo of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein together.
Prosecutors considered including photos of the defendants and abuse locations in the indictment itself to facilitate their use at a press conference.
The email chain shows internal DOJ procedural discussions about managing public perception and evidence presentation.
